GapFillInput.Title: Quantifiers
GapFillInput.Instruction: Type a word in each gap.

Content.Question:
What do you need to take when you travel in the jungle?
First of all, don’t carry too much luggage. Take as
little as possible so that you can carry it in a medium-sized
backpack. You don’t need to take any sunscreen
or sunglasses as there’s no direct sunlight because
of all the trees and vegetation.
The most important thing is to drink plenty|lots of water.
You won’t be able to carry enough|much bottled water so
you’ll need a lot of water purification tablets, which
you can use with water from streams and rivers. What about food?
Energy bars are the best. They will keep you alive for three days but
you can also find and eat some fruit if you need to.
Don’t bring a fishing rod. It’s too dangerous with all the crocodiles. At night you need a good fire to keep insects and animals away. Carry several|some boxes of matches (you can’t have too many matches) but if the fire goes out, make sure you take a torch and some|several batteries. Also take some insect repellent and a strong knife.
You need to keep comfortable so take a few changes of clothes and some toilet paper. You will be fine if you use a bit|lot of common sense.
